actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide to individuals who have attained the age of sixty-two a refundable credit against income tax for increases in real property taxes and utility bills.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individuals who have attained age 62 an income tax credit for the amount by which their property taxes and utility bills for their principal residences have increased since such individuals reached age 62 or purchased their home, whichever occurred later.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide to individuals who have attained the age of sixty-two a refundable credit against income tax for increases in real property taxes and utility bills.
